body_html:
that's a bit of a stretch; if you have a large-ish (more than a few cache lines) data structure, where you start for such a case does not matter.

for example, lets say your data structure is 10 cache lines in size (which is pretty tiny for tensors)

you can do (O=odd E = even)
OEOEOEOEOE
or
EOEOEOEOEO

if you would do 32 bytes

if you only do 64 bytes, sure, you only get
EOEOEOEOEO
but you still have 5 E's and 5 O's... you don't get disproportional pressure.

body:
that's a bit of a stretch; if you have a large-ish (more than a few cache lines) data structure, where you start for such a case does not matter.

for example, lets say your data structure is 10 cache lines in size (which is pretty tiny for tensors)

you can do (O=odd E = even)
OEOEOEOEOE
or
EOEOEOEOEO

if you would do 32 bytes

if you only do 64 bytes, sure, you only get
EOEOEOEOEO
but you still have 5 E's and 5 O's... you don't get disproportional pressure.
